greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array A(n,k), n >= 0, k >= 0, read by antidiagonals, where column k is the expansion of e.g.f. Product_{i>k} exp(-x^i).
formula: A(0,k) = 1, A(1,k) = A(2,k) = ... = A(k,k) = 0 and A(n,k) = - Sum_{i=k..n-1} (i+1)!*binomial(n-1,i)*A(n-1-i,k) for n > k.
maple: seq(seq(A(n, d-n), n=0..d), d=0..12);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 30 2017
mathematica: A[n_, k_] /; 0 <= k <= n := A[n, k] = -Sum[A[n-j, k] Binomial[n-1, j-1] j!, {j, k+1, n}];
Table[A[n-k, k], {n, 0, 10}, {k, n, 0, -1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 06 2019 *)
results.author: _Seiichi Manyama_, Sep 30 2017
